oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1979 Faculty Show
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bryn Mawr College
Bryn Mawr College History
Universities & colleges
Theatrical productions
Teachers
Photographers
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Faculty members performing in the skit "History of Art 609B: Fellini's 'Beast of the Gods' in the History of Western Thought: An Ontological, Phenomenological and Tautological Approach" as part of the 1979 Faculty Show "Curriculi, Curricula!" Pictured: back row (left to right) Gerard Defaux (satyr), Greg Dickerson (Silenus), Neil Forsyth (satyr), Kathleen Slane Wright (nymph), Barbara Lane (nymph), Machteld Mellink (nymph). Front row (Left to Right) Kirsty Dickerson (young Bacchus), Richard Ellis (Mercury), Matthew Yarczower (Jupiter), Dale Kinney (Cybele), Kenneth Strothkamp (Poseidon), Jean Potter (Ceres), Charles Mitchell (Apollo). Backdrop designed by Fritz Janschka. From the James Snyder files.
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Please cite Bryn Mawr College Special Collections when using this image file. High-quality scans of materials in the collection are offered for research, publication, and commercial use at the discretion of Bryn Mawr College. Bryn Mawr College History
Universities & colleges
Photographs
Women
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of Mary Elizabeth Garrett at May Day. She is standing on the lawn and dressed in academic garb with students dressed in white surrounding her. The inscription on the back says that the photo was given to M. Carey Thomas on October 8, 1915 by Miss (Katharine A.) Page (Loring), May Queen. She is likely to be the woman standing next to Garrett in the photo.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Students in large dorm room
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bryn Mawr College
Bryn Mawr College History
Students
Universities & colleges
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Students are in very large dorm room, with a door to the left and a door to the right. Three students are playing cards and drinking milk, one students is sewing basketballs, another student is playing the accordian, and one last student is playing the drums. There are photos on a small stand, as well as a large area rug, additional cushions on a window bench, a rocking chair, a desk, and a wicker waste basket. There is electricity in the room, as there are cords from the lamps.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Exterior view of the front of Denbigh Hall taken the morning after the fire of 1902. The photograph is taken from the southwest and only the far right side of the front of Denbigh is visible. Parts of the building, especially the top floor on the far right side of the image looks severely damaged by the fire. A wheelbarrow is visible in the foreground of the image.

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bryn Mawr College
Bryn Mawr College History
Universities & colleges
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two students working at a table in a biology lab. One holds a petri dish under a microscope while she adjusts its contents with an awl; the other dissects a rat using a small pair of scissors. The student on the left with the microscope is identified as Rosemary Gilmartin, class of 1947.

Vining, Elizabeth Gray, 1902-1999

Universities & colleges

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Henry J. Cadbury, Elizabeth Gray Vining and Josephine Young pictured seated next to each other, at what is identified as a Directors meeting. Several women writing on notepads are in the background. Cadbury and Vining are identified as trustees and Vining as a member of the class of 1923 while Case is identified as both a Director and a member of the class of 1928.
